controller

Class Controller

  • java.lang.Object
    • javax.servlet.GenericServlet
      • javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet
        • controller.Controller
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, javax.servlet.Servlet, javax.servlet.ServletConfig

    @WebServlet(name="Controller",
            urlPatterns="/")
public class Controller
extends javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet
    See Also:

      • init

        public void init()
        Overrides:
        init in class javax.servlet.GenericServlet

      • doPost

        protected void doPost(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                      javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
               throws java.io.IOException,
                      javax.servlet.ServletException
        Main function of the Controller servlet. receives requests and responses and acts in accordance to their contents:
        • Logs the user in by calling the signUserIn() function;
        • Signs the user up by calling the signUserUp() function;
        • Logs the user out by calling the signUserOut() function;
        • Updates the user's last access to the application.
        Overrides:
        doPost in class javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet
        Parameters:
        request - the servlet request.
        response - the servlet response.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - I/O Exception.
        javax.servlet.ServletException - Servlet Exception.

      • doGet

        protected void doGet(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                     javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
              throws java.io.IOException,
                     javax.servlet.ServletException
        Decides on the first page the user sees. Will show the signIn.jsp page by default.
        Overrides:
        doGet in class javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet
        Parameters:
        request - the servlet request.
        response - the servlet response.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - I/O Exception.
        javax.servlet.ServletException - Servlet Exception.

      • signUserIn

        private void signUserIn(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                        javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
        Signs the user in by authenticating them using the DataAccess.authenticateUser() function. Calls the showPages() function.
        Parameters:
        request - the servlet request.
        response - the servlet response.

      • signUserUp

        private void signUserUp(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                        javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
        Signs the user up by authenticating them using the DataAccess.newUser() function. Calls the showPages() function.
        Parameters:
        request - the servlet request.
        response - the servlet response.

      • signUserOut

        private void signUserOut(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                         javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
                  throws java.io.IOException,
                         javax.servlet.ServletException
        Signs the user out. Will check if the user wished to delete their account and act on it.
        Parameters:
        request - the servlet request.
        response - the servlet response.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - I/O Exception.
        javax.servlet.ServletException - Servlet Exception.

      • addOrRemoveSet

        private void addOrRemoveSet(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                            javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response,
                            java.lang.String action)
        Adds or removes a Key/Value pair depending on the action parameter.
        Parameters:
        request - the servlet request.
        response - the servlet response.
        action - will be either "Add" or "Remove" here.

      • showPages

        private void showPages(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                       javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response,
                       java.lang.String email,
                       boolean result,
                       boolean login,
                       java.lang.String error)
        Shows either the account.jsp page or the (error.jsp page depending on the result parameter. Sends user to the requested page as an attribute for further use.
        Parameters:
        request - the servlet request.
        response - the servlet response.
        email - the user's email. Used to get an instance of the user to send to the pages.
        result - will be True if the user was authenticated or created successfully. False otherwise.
        login - will be True if the user is logging in. False otherwise.
        error - the error code of the page, in case an error was detected.

      • handleError

        private void handleError(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                         javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response,
                         java.lang.String email,
                         java.lang.String error)
                  throws java.io.IOException,
                         javax.servlet.ServletException
        Error handling. Showing The correct page upon weird behaviour.
        Parameters:
        request - the servlet request.
        response - the servlet response.
        email - the user's email. Used to get an instance of the user to send to the pages.
        error - the error code of the page, in case an error was detected.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - I/O Exception.
        javax.servlet.ServletException - Servlet Exception.
